Name: Issue 257
Introduction: Hope everyone's social isolation is going well.  Take care of yourselves and enjoy the newsletter. Big news is that Xamarin.Forms 4.6 has been released with some crazy good enhancements. Stay safe ♥ Kym

Articles.Title: GitHub Protips: Tips, tricks, hacks, and secrets from Alyson La
Articles.Description: This is the fourth in a series of posts featuring protips from GitHubbers for improving productivity, efficiency, and more.
Articles.Author: Alyson La

Articles.Title: Enabling LLVM for your Xamarin.iOS custom build targets
Articles.Description: Build targets are not only great to differentiate between a Debug and Release builds. You can also use them for targeting different environments or configurations of your app.
Articles.Author: Mark Allibone

Articles.Title: Connecting to locahost over HTTPS
Articles.Description: Last year, David Britch wrote about how to connect to localhost over HTTPS from iOS simulators and Android emulators. Things have moved on and now he has updated it.
Articles.Author: David Britch

Articles.Title: Running older versions of Xcode and Xamarin
Articles.Description: We have all faced the nightmare of updating our tools such as the IDE and being met with messages when we try to do something such as build or run. Damian faced such an issue recently with Xcode and Xamarin and has shared how he resolved it.
Articles.Author: Damian Mehers

Articles.Title: MaterialFrame leveled up with a Blur theme!
Articles.Description: MaterialFrame is a great looking control that implements different themes, including Acrylic.  Well it does now after someone pointed out that it was doing it all wrong ;-)  But it's fixed now.
Articles.Author: Jean-Marie Alfonsi

Articles.Title: EmptyView with BindableLayouts
Articles.Description: With Xamarin.Forms 4.6  we get support for EmptyView in BindableLayouts. That's was a missing piece from the incredibly useful BIndableLayout component. **Note: Article is in Spanish**
Articles.Author: Javier Suárez

Articles.Title: Examples, and tips for creating applications in Xamarin Forms
Articles.Description: Luis Matos brings together some tips to improve your mobile development application skills with Examples and Tips for Xamarin Forms.
Articles.Author: Luis Matos

Articles.Title: Quarantine Bingo
Articles.Description: When I saw Matt had created this I was super excited, what a fun use of some of my favourite technologies! Using Speech to Text and Xamarin, he created an app that will automate part of playing bingo!!
Articles.Author: Matt Soucoup

Articles.Title: Xamarin.Forms ColorPicker component
Articles.Description: Ever needed a ColorPicker component for Xamarin.Forms? There's a nuget for that. **Note: Article is in Portuguese**
Articles.Author: Thiago Bertuzzi

Articles.Title: Xamarin Forms Acrylic Material Frames
Articles.Description: The Fluent Design System helps you create modern, bold UI that incorporates light, depth, motion, material, and scale. Acrylic is a Fluent Design System component that adds physical texture (material) and depth to your app.
Articles.Author: Samir G.C

Articles.Title: 6 Ways in Which Xamarin Forms Evolved
Articles.Description: This a great post from Damien, discussing how Xamarin.Forms has evolved over the years. It is a fantastic reminder of just how far we have come and the amazing work from the team and the community.
Articles.Author: Damien Doumer

Articles.Title: Six Things to Love in Xamarin.Forms 4.6 | The Xamarin Show
Articles.Description: This week, James is joined by friend of the show David Ortinau, Principal Program Manager for Xamarin, who shows off one of the coolest new features in Xamarin.Forms 4.6. This including updates to Visual Material, Shell, Expander, C# UI markup extensions, font embedding, and more! [**Six Things to Love in Xamarin.Forms 4.6 | The Xamarin Show**](https://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/XamarinShow/Six-Things-to-Love-in-XamarinForms-46--The-Xamarin-Show)

Articles.Title: COVIDSafe App Teardown & Panel Discussion
Articles.Description: The Australian Government has released the COVIDSafe app for helping track cases of community transmission of COVID.  Whilst technically not a Xamarin application, some of our wonderful community members have taken apart the application and done a technical evaluation.   WIth: Alec Tucker, Geoff Huntley, Kate Carruthers, Matthew Robbins and Troy Hunt It's also worth checking out an interesting [Twitter thread](https://twitter.com/matthewrdev/status/1254336105203200000) by Matthew Robbins

Articles.Title: Xamarin.Forms 101: Basic Animations
Articles.Description: Let's take a step back in a new mini-series that I like to call Xamarin.Forms 101. In each episode we will walk through a basic building block of Xamarin.Forms to help you build awesome cross-platform iOS, Android, and Windows applications in .NET.
Articles.Author: Maddy Leger

Articles.Title: Merge Conflict: 199: Update, Rewrite, or Throw It Away
Articles.Description: Frank is having a debate on whether he should update iCircuit to the latest bits or rewrite the apps with Xamarin.Forms. They discuss his options and James throws a bunch of crazy ideas his way.
Articles.Author: Merge Conflict

Articles.Title: Xamarin.Forms 4.6 Available
Articles.Description: Today Xamarin.Forms 4.6 ships with a host of improvements, including several new feature previews. [**Xamarin.Forms 4.6 Available Today! : Xamarin Blog**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/xamarin-forms-4-6/) by [David Ortinau]
